This app includes:

1. A date range input with all possible parameters configured:
   - `id`: Unique identifier for the input
   - `label`: Display label
   - `start`: Initial start date
   - `end`: Initial end date
   - `min`: Minimum allowed date
   - `max`: Maximum allowed date
   - `format`: Date display format
   - `startview`: Initial calendar view ("decade")
   - `weekstart`: First day of week (1 for Monday)
   - `language`: Language for calendar text
   - `separator`: Custom separator between dates
   - `width`: Input width
   - `autoclose`: Whether to close calendar on selection

2. A simple text output that displays the currently selected date range

The app demonstrates all the parameters while keeping the implementation minimal. The only additional component is a text output to show the selected dates, which helps demonstrate that the input is working correctly.

Key features:
- Uses express mode syntax
- No external data dependencies
- All parameters of input_date_range are demonstrated
- Minimal additional components
- Clear display of selected values
